definition: at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: The protesters are just reminding those in power to look down.
sentences.chinese: 示威者就是在提醒那些當權者往下看。

sentences.english: Cowardly Christianity never poses a threat to the powers and principalities of darkness.
sentences.chinese: 懦弱的基督徒從來不會對黑暗勢力及當權者構成威脅。

sentences.english: There's a history of the underdog using standup comedy to speak truth to power.
sentences.chinese: 向來都有被壓迫的人借滑稽說笑向當權者說出真相。

sentences.english: Companies need to cultivate cordial relations with local potentates, too.
sentences.chinese: 公司還需要巴結本地當權者。

sentences.english: Some said that Chinese rulers are really stupid, using money to buy troubles for themselves.
sentences.chinese: 有人說中國大陸的當權者真傻，用錢買氣受。

sentences.english: This part of the building is used by local authorities for meetings.
sentences.chinese: 建築的這部分是給本地當權者開會使用的。

sentences.english: People in power must bear some responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 當權者必須肩負某些責任。

sentences.english: It is sometimes hard to explain to authorities why one would want to do such things.
sentences.chinese: 有時候不太容易向當權者解釋爲什麼有人愛幹這類事。

sentences.english: Those in power have to resist the temptation to crack down on dissidents.
sentences.chinese: 當權者必須抵抗住鎮壓異見的誘惑。

sentences.english: Is he here talking about these authorities who crucified Jesus, that is the Romans?
sentences.chinese: 他在這說的是釘死耶穌的當權者，也就是羅馬人嗎？

definition: to run amok (idiom); to commit outrages
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
to criticize (as a matter of principle)
